Definition: A consumer price index (CPI) measures changes in the price level of consumer goods and services purchased by households
Methodology Notes: Data obtained from the above mentioned sources is used to construct a base dataset. For the current year, data is forecasted using the quarterly/monthly series from national statistical organizations and central banks. For later years, multiple forecasts are derived using consensus approach, various smoothing and autoregressive models in the time series framework and the values are benchmarked using data from national and international sources. Final forecasts are chosen from alternative scenarios based on measures of forecasting accuracy and economic significance.

Definition: A consumer price index (CPI) measures changes in the price level of consumer goods and services purchased by households
Methodology Notes: Data obtained from the above mentioned sources is used to construct a base dataset. For the current year, data is forecasted using the quarterly/monthly series from national statistical organizations and central banks. For later years, multiple forecasts are derived using consensus approach, various smoothing and autoregressive models in the time series framework and the values are benchmarked using data from national and international sources. Final forecasts are chosen from alternative scenarios based on measures of forecasting accuracy and economic significance.
